page.title: 10Religion in Bilbrough
page.content: This is one of 4 parishes ministered by Rev.Francis Cordingley, the others being St.Mary,Askham Richard,St.John, Healaugh,and All Saints,Wighill. St.James,Bilbrough has a new vicarage (circa 1960) in Back Lane.United Parish Eucharist is held at 10.30 a.m. on successive Sundays in each village in turn.Holy Communion 9 a.m. and Evensong 6 p.m. are held at irregular intervals.Occasionally a joint service is held at Askham Richard with the Methodists. The first church was probably Norman. The Chantry Chapel is all that is left.In 1873 the church was rebuilt in Norman style.Seating was increased from 76 to 156.The cost was Â£2 264 given by Thomas Fairfax, who also built the school for Â£154.The Chapel contains the tombs of John Norton, Chapel Founder and Black Tom Fairfax.
